facial rejuvenation

rhinoplasty

procedures overview
facial rejuvenation

brow liftchin surgerycosmetic ear surgeryeyelid surgeryfaceliftfacial implantsforehead lift

hair replacementinjectables & wrinkle treatmentlaser surgerylip enhancementscar revisionskin resurfacing & peels

rhinoplasty

functional rhinoplastynasal cosmetic surgery

nasal filler/non-surgicalnasal reconstruction

reconstructive surgery

cleft lip and palate repairface transplantsfacial nerve disordersfacial trauma

head and neck cancer reconstructionotoplasty/microtiascar revisionskin cancer reconstruction

find a
facial plastic
surgeon
use our interactive search feature to
locate an aafprs member near you














2024 survey results are in! press release | february 4, 2025  from the rise of younger patients opting for facelifts to an ongoing boom in male cosmetic surgeries, the survey underscores how advancements in medicine, evolving societal norms, and cultural influences are fueling a growing demand for facial plastic surgery.... more

visit the aafprs youtube channel! procedure videos help to educate prospective patients presented by board certified facial plastic surgeons

for cleft palate correction a facial plastic surgeon is key despite their prevalence, repairing these defects properly requires the expertise of a doctor who's been trained...more

next

_9x99








							please enter your search criteria to view results










view all surgeons near you




trust your face to a facial plastic surgeon
with many different types of aesthetic surgeons in practice today, it is important to make an informed decision when considering an elective or reconstructive procedure. if you are considering surgery of the face and neck, that area of expertise is facial plastic surgery. find a surgeon who is board-certified in the correct field of expertise.
all aafprs members are board certified by a specialty board recognized by the american board of medical specialties. a majority are certified by the american board of otolaryngology—head and neck surgery, which includes facial plastic surgery. others may be certified in plastic surgery, ophthalmology, or dermatology. in particular, an immense number of aafprs members have achieved board certification by the american board of facial plastic and reconstructive surgery (abfprs), which requires prior certification by either the american board of otolaryngology—head and neck surgery or the american board of plastic surgery. for more than 30 years, the abfprs has been actively dedicated to improving the quality of facial plastic surgery available to the public by measuring the qualifications of candidate surgeons against certain rigorous standards.






facial rejuvenation
cosmetic treatments that aim to restore a more youthful and appealing appearance to the face. procedures may include changing the shape of the nose, ears, chin, cheekbones and neckline. facial rejuvenation     also consists of non-invasive techniques, and is more popular than ever.
 

rhinoplasty
plastic surgery procedure of the nose. reconstructive surgery may be performed to improve the form or functions of the nose. cosmetic rhinoplasty procedures  improve the appearance or shape of the nose.
 

reconstructive surgery
reconstructive surgery    involves the correction of congenital, traumatic and post-surgical deformities. patients with skin cancer may also require facial reconstruction.
 





i used to hide my injuries from domestic violence, but now i have the confidence to share my story so other women know they are not alone. someone can help, and i’m so grateful for all the emotional and surgical support i’ve received from dr. garcia.
see our humanitarian heroes  at work.
